xwikidoc.name: Mailing Lists
xwikidoc.creator: xwiki:XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.author: xwiki:XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.title: Mailing Lists
xwikidoc.content:
The mailing lists are the main communication channels for the PhenoTips community. There are 3 of them that you can post to (click on the links to subscribe and manage your account), and 2 that you can subscribe to in order to receive notifications:
* **[[announcements AT phenotips.org>>http://mail.phenotips.org/mailman/listinfo/announcements]]**: Important announcements related to PhenoTips. This is a low traffic list only with official announcements. * **[[users AT phenotips.org>>http://mail.phenotips.org/mailman/listinfo/users]]**: For questions about using PhenoTips, suggestions for improvements, ideas, etc. * **[[support AT phenotips.org>>http://mail.phenotips.org/mailman/listinfo/support]]**: For specific problems encountered while using the software. * **[[devs AT phenotips.org>>http://mail.phenotips.org/mailman/listinfo/devs]]**: For PhenoTips development itself. * **[[notifications AT phenotips.org>>http://mail.phenotips.org/mailman/listinfo/notifications]]**: All code commits, issues and Continuous Build failures are sent to this list. PhenoTips developers must be subscribed to this list to follow what's going on.
Before posting on the lists, please make sure to follow [[these posting tips>>http://www.apache.org/dev/contrib-email-tips.html]].
{{warning}} Before sending mails to any of the lists mentioned above you'll need to be subscribed to the list. Be very careful to send the mail with the email address you've used to subscribe or your mail won't make it to the list and will be rejected. You can register by clicking on the links above (you can also use these links for unsubscribing). {{/warning}}
== Archives ==
The mailing lists are publicly archived.
* [[announcements archives>>http://mail.phenotips.org/pipermail/announcements/]] * [[users archives>>http://mail.phenotips.org/pipermail/users/]] * [[devs archives>>http://mail.phenotips.org/pipermail/devs/]]
